inspirationalQuote.text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
inspirationalQuote.author: William Osler

paretoBanner.title: The Pareto Principle in Medicine
paretoBanner.description: Focus on the 20% of topics that appear in 80% of exams. Prioritize high-yield subjects to maximize your score.

questionOfTheDay.question: A 55-year-old male presents with sudden-onset chest pain radiating to his left arm. ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads V1-V4. Which coronary artery is most likely occluded?

subjects.name: Anatomy
subjects.description: The study of the structure of the human body, from macroscopic to microscopic levels. Essential for all other medical fields.

textbooks.title: BD Chaurasia's Human Anatomy, Vol 1: Upper Limb & Thorax
textbooks.author: B.D. Chaurasia

textbooks.title: BD Chaurasia's Human Anatomy, Vol 2: Lower Limb, Abdomen & Pelvis
textbooks.author: B.D. Chaurasia

textbooks.title: BD Chaurasia's Human Anatomy, Vol 3: Head, Neck & Brain
textbooks.author: B.D. Chaurasia

dissection-manual.title: Cunningham's Manual: Vol 1 - Head, Neck & Brain
dissection-manual.author: Cunningham

subjects.name: Physiology
subjects.description: Understand the functions of the human body, from cellular mechanisms to the coordinated actions of organ systems.

subjects.name: Biochemistry
subjects.description: Explore the chemical processes within and related to living organisms, forming the basis of life.

subjects.name: Pathology
subjects.description: The study of the causes and effects of disease or injury. The bridge between science and medicine.

subjects.name: Microbiology
subjects.description: The study of microscopic organisms, such as bacteria, viruses, archaea, fungi and protozoa.

subjects.name: Pharmacology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine concerned with the uses, effects, and modes of action of drugs.

subjects.name: Community Medicine
subjects.description: Focuses on the health of populations, aiming to prevent disease and promote health at the community level.

subjects.name: Forensic Medicine
subjects.description: Application of medical knowledge to the investigation of crime, particularly in establishing the causes of injury or death.

subjects.name: ENT
subjects.description: Otorhinolaryngology: The study and treatment of diseases of the ear, nose, throat, and related structures of the head and neck.

subjects.name: Ophthalmology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis and treatment of eye disorders.

subjects.name: General Medicine
subjects.description: The medical specialty dealing with the prevention, diagnosis, and nonsurgical treatment of adult diseases.

textbooks.title: Davidson's Principles and Practice of Medicine
textbooks.author: 23rd Edition

clinical-books.title: Alagappan Manual of Practical Medicine Book
clinical-books.author: R Alagappan

subjects.name: General Surgery
subjects.description: A surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including esophagus, stomach, small bowel, colon, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, and often the thyroid gland.

textbooks.title: Bailey & Love's Short Practice of Surgery
textbooks.author: 27th Edition

clinical-books.title: Long Cases in General Surgery: Rajamahendran
clinical-books.author: Rajamahendran

subjects.name: OBG
subjects.description: Obstetrics and Gynaecology: Two surgical-medical specialties dealing with the female reproductive organs in their pregnant and non-pregnant state, respectively.

subjects.name: Pediatrics
subjects.description: The branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents.

subjects.name: Orthopedics
subjects.description: The branch of surgery concerned with conditions involving the musculoskeletal system.

subjects.name: Radiology
subjects.description: The medical discipline that uses medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases within the bodies of animals and humans.

subjects.name: Anesthesiology
subjects.description: The medical specialty concerned with the total perioperative care of patients before, during and after surgery.

subjects.name: Psychiatry
subjects.description: The medical specialty devoted to the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of mental disorders.

subjects.name: Dermatology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine dealing with the skin, nails, hair and its diseases.

subjects.name: Oncology
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of cancer.

textbooks.title: DeVita, Hellman, and Rosenberg's Cancer: Principles & Practice of Oncology
textbooks.author: 11th Edition

subjects.name: Cardiology
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that deals with the disorders of the heart as well as some parts of the circulatory system.

textbooks.title: Braunwald's Heart Disease: A Textbook of Cardiovascular Medicine
textbooks.author: 11th Edition
